entities.description: The time frame of the past 30 days, including today's date.
Number of whole days missed from school due to sickness or injury.
The reason for missing school, specifically due to being sick or injured.
Number of days missed due to staying home with a sick child or family member.
A period of at least 2 weeks during which there is either depressed mood or loss of interest or pleasure in nearly all activities.
Age of respondent when a reported period started.
Types of feelings experienced by the respondent, such as feeling sad, empty, or depressed.
The length of time for which the respondent felt a certain way, such as several days or longer.
Level of impairment of school or work life due to emotional or mental health issues.
A loss of interest and pleasure in most of the activities the respondent usually enjoys.
Other severe problems experienced alongside with mood issues, including changes in sleep, eating, energy, and the ability to keep mind on things.

relationships.description: Relates the survey to the time period of the past 30 days.
Indicates the number of days the respondent missed school due to sickness or injury.
Defines the reason for the school absence, such as being sick or injured.
Indicates the number of days the respondent missed school due to caring for a sick child or family member.
Indicates the feelings experienced by the respondent, such as feeling sad, empty, or depressed.
Defines the length of time for which the respondent experienced certain feelings.
Shows that certain feelings like sadness or depression cause impairment in school or work life.
Indicates that major depressive episode results in significant loss of interest and pleasure in most activities.
Indicates severe problems experienced alongside a major depressive episode, including changes in sleep, eating, and energy levels.
Indicates the age at which the respondent’s major depressive episode started.
